sense.name: stick to, bond to
sense.commentary:
Note: Includes: ADHERE TO
Syntax Is: NP1 ADHERE (TO) (NP2)
sense.examples: Spray foam is fast, adheres completely, and won't fall off. Raised panels might also consist of wood veneers adhered to plywood. We used it in its transdermal form, which is a patch that adheres to the skin. These weatherproof vinyl signs have a magnetic backing that adheres to metal surfaces.

sense.name: follow (policy or belief, idea, or opinion)
sense.commentary:
Note: Includes: ADHERE TO
Syntax Is: NP1 ADHERE TO NP2
sense.examples: You must adhere to the rules. Both men adhered effectively to the overall strategy of their campaigns. If the high court adhered strictly to precedent, it would be unable to correct mistakes in constitutional interpretation. They adhered to their plan. The content production adheres to the intrinsic theme. The residents of this village adhered to Catholicism. It was indeed politically conscious, but always adhered loyally to the government's decisions. As emperor, Lothair adhered loyally to the Concordat of Worms. Both before and after the issue of the Great Charter Hubert adhered faithfully to the king.
